      program combined
      implicit none

      ! For the first program
      integer :: N, M, i, x, y, counter, iostat
      integer, allocatable :: num(:)
      logical, allocatable :: red(:)

      ! For the second program
      integer :: len_in, len_out
      character(len=20) :: counter_str
      character(len=1000) :: out_str   ! we build the output string for the second program
      character :: c, prev

      ! For the third program
      integer, parameter :: mod_base = 2019
      integer :: n_third, j, digit, radix, tmp
      integer, allocatable :: mod_arr(:), mod_cnt(:)
      integer(kind=8) :: ans

      ! Step 1: Read N and M
      read(*,*) N, M

      ! Allocate arrays for boxes
      allocate(num(1:N))
      allocate(red(1:N))

      ! Initialize boxes
      num(1) = 1
      red(1) = .true.
      do i = 2, N
          num(i) = 1
          red(i) = .false.
      end do

      ! Read M moves
      do i = 1, M
          read(*,*) x, y
          if (num(x) == 0) then
              cycle
          else if (num(x) == 1) then
              num(x) = 0
              num(y) = num(y) + 1
              if (red(x)) then
                  red(y) = .true.
              end if
              red(x) = .false.
          else
              num(x) = num(x) - 1
              num(y) = num(y) + 1
              if (red(x)) then
                  red(y) = .true.
              end if
          end if
      end do

      ! Count the red boxes
      counter = 0
      do i = 1, N
          if (red(i)) then
              counter = counter + 1
          end if
      end do

      ! Convert counter to string
      write(counter_str, '(I0)') counter   ! I0: minimum width without leading spaces
      len_in = len_trim(counter_str)

      ! Process the string for the second program
      out_str = ''
      out_str(1:1) = counter_str(1:1)
      len_out = 1

      do i = 2, len_in
          c = counter_str(i:i)
          if (c >= 'a' .and. c <= 'z') then
              prev = counter_str(i-1:i-1)
              if (prev < 'a' .or. prev > 'z') then
                  len_out = len_out + 1
                  out_str(len_out:len_out) = ' '
              end if
              len_out = len_out + 1
              out_str(len_out:len_out) = c
          else if (c == '.' .or. c == ',' .or. c == '!' .or. c == '?') then
              len_out = len_out + 1
              out_str(len_out:len_out) = c
          end if
      end do

      ! Now, the string for the third program is out_str(1:len_out)
      n_third = len_out

      ! Allocate mod_arr: from 0 to n_third-1
      allocate(mod_arr(0:n_third-1))
      allocate(mod_cnt(0:mod_base-1))

      mod_cnt = 0
      radix = 1

      do i = 0, n_third-1
          j = n_third - i   ! the index in the string (1-indexed) for the character at position n_third - i
          digit = ichar(out_str(j:j)) - ichar('0')
          tmp = mod(digit * radix, mod_base)

          if (i > 0) then
              tmp = mod(tmp + mod_arr(i-1), mod_base)
          end if

          mod_arr(i) = tmp
          mod_cnt(tmp) = mod_cnt(tmp) + 1

          radix = mod(radix * 10, mod_base)
      end do

      mod_cnt(0) = mod_cnt(0) + 1

      ans = 0

              ans = ans + int(mod_cnt(i), kind=8) * int(mod_cnt(i)-1, kind=8) / 2
          end if
      end do

      print *, ans

      deallocate(num, red, mod_arr, mod_cnt)

      end program combined
